Module contents¶

pym.models.DbBase¶

Our base class for declarative models.

alias of Base

class pym.models.DefaultMixin¶

Bases: builtins.object

Mixin to add Parenchym’s standard fields to a model class.

These are: id, ctime, owner, mtime, editor.

dump()¶
classmethod find(sess, obj)¶

Finds given object and returns its instance.

Input object may be the integer ID of a DB record, or a value that is checked in IDENTITY_COL. If object is already the requested instance, it is returned unchanged.

Raises NoResultFound if object is unknown.

is_deleted()¶
IDENTITY_COL = 'name'¶

Name of a column that can be used to identify a record uniquely, besides ID.

Bases: colander.Schema

Schema for basic login form with CSRF token.

Creates bound data model.

pym.models.exists(sess, name, schema='public')¶

Checks if given relation exists.

Relation may be:

r = ordinary table i = index S = sequence v = view f = foreign table m = materialized view

Parameters:
  • sess – Instance of a DB session.
  • name – Name of the relation.
  • schema – Optional name of schema. Defaults to ‘public’.
Returns:

One of above mentioned letters if relation exists, None if not.
pym.models.init(settings, prefix, invalidate_caches=False)¶

Initializes scoped SQLAlchemy by rc settings.

Creates engine, binds a scoped session and declarative base. Call this function for global initialization of the WebApp.

Initialises the module globals DbEngine, DbSession and DbBase. The session is joined into the Zope Transaction Manager.

Parameters:
  • settings – Dict with settings
  • prefix – Prefix for SQLAlchemy settings
pym.models.init_unscoped(settings, prefix)¶

Initializes unscoped SQLAlchemy by rc settings.

Creates engine, binds a scoped session and declarative base. Call this function for global initialization of the WebApp.

Initialises the module globals DbEngine, DbSession and DbBase. This session has no external transaction manager.

Parameters:
  • settings – Dict with settings
  • prefix – Prefix for SQLAlchemy settings
Returns:

Dict with DbEngine, DbSession and DbBase.
pym.models.receive_before_update(mapper, connection, target)¶
pym.models.todata(rs, fully_qualified=False, fmap=None, excludes=None, includes=None, dict_class=<class 'collections.OrderedDict'>) → list¶

Transmogrifies a result set into a list of dicts.

Applies todict() to each iterated row. For params not explained here, see todict().

Parameters:rs (list | sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query | sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.DeclarativeMeta) – Data to transmogrify. May be some iterable like a list or a result set from a query. May also be a single ORM entity.
Returns:A list of the transmogrified records.
pym.models.todict(o, fully_qualified=False, fmap=None, excludes=None, includes=None, dict_class=<class 'collections.OrderedDict'>) → dict¶

Transmogrifies data object into dict.

Inspired by http://blog.mitechie.com/2010/04/01/hacking-the-sqlalchemy-base-class/ Converts only physical table columns.

By default, the created dict is a OrderedDict which has column id as the first, and the other columns of PymMixin at the end.

Parameters:
  • o (sqlalchemy.util.KeyedTuple | sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.DeclarativeMeta) – Data object to transmogrify.
  • fully_qualified (bool) – Whether the keys of returned dict are fully qualified column names or not. N.b. that full column names are only available if o has attribute __table__, which e.g. for KeyedTuples is not the case.
  • fmap (dict) – Mapping of column names to functions. Each function is called to build the value for this column. May be a lambda expression.
  • excludes (NoneType | list) – List of column names to exclude.
  • includes (NoneType | list) – List of column names to include. If None, all columns are included
  • dict_class (type) – Class of the dict to build. Defaults to collections.OrderedDict.
pym.models.CSRF_SCHEMA_NODE = <colander.SchemaNode object at 140434577480448 (named csrf_token)>¶

Colander schema node for a hidden field containing a CSRF token.

Usage:

class LoginSchema(colander.MappingSchema):
    login = colander.SchemaNode(colander.String())
    pwd   = colander.SchemaNode(colander.String(),
                widget=deform.widget.PasswordWidget()
            )
    csrf_token = CSRF_SCHEMA_NODE

When you create a schema instance, do not forget to bind the current request like so:

sch = LoginSchema().bind(request=self.request)
pym.models.DbEngine = None¶

Default DB engine.
